00001 /*
00002  * NetworkManagerCLI.cpp
00003  *
00004  *  Created on: Nov 18, 2012
00005  *      Author: mitchell
00006  *
00007  *  A simple command line interface to talk to the Oryx Network Manager
00008  *  Each command is broken out into a function
00009  */
00010 
00011 #include "ros/ros.h"
00012 #include "oryx_network_manager/NetworkConnections.h"
00013 #include "oryx_network_manager/NetworkDevices.h"
00014 #include "oryx_network_manager/ActiveNetworkConnections.h"
00015 #include "oryx_network_manager/ActivateConnection.h"
00016 #include <sstream>
00017 
00018 using namespace oryx_network_manager;
00019 
00020 void list_connections_callback(const NetworkConnections::ConstPtr& connections, bool run_once)
00021 {
00022   printf("Oryx Network Connections\n");
00023   printf("------------------------------------------------\n");
00024   for (unsigned int i = 0; i < connections->list.size(); ++i)
00025   {
00026     NetworkConnection connection = connections->list[i];
00027     printf("\t%s (%s)\n", connection.name.c_str(), connection.path.c_str());
00028 
00029     printf("\t\t%s Connection\n", connection.connection_type.c_str());
00030 
00031     if (!connection.wifi_ssid.empty())
00032       printf("\t\tSSID: %s\n", connection.wifi_ssid.c_str());
00033     if (!connection.wifi_security.empty())
00034       printf("\t\tSecurity: %s\n", connection.wifi_security.c_str());
00035     printf("\n");
00036   }
00037   if (run_once)
00038     ros::shutdown();
00039 }
00040 
00041 void list_connections(bool run_once)
00042 {
00043   ros::NodeHandle n;
00044   ros::Subscriber connections_sub = n.subscribe<NetworkConnections>("oryx_network_connections", 10,
00045       boost::bind(list_connections_callback, _1, run_once));
00046   ros::spin();
00047 }
00048 
00049 void list_active_connections_callback(const ActiveNetworkConnections::ConstPtr& active_connections, bool run_once)
00050 {
00051   printf("Oryx Active Network Connections\n");
00052   printf("------------------------------------------------\n");
00053   for (unsigned int i = 0; i < active_connections->list.size(); ++i)
00054   {
00055     ActiveNetworkConnection connection = active_connections->list[i];
00056     printf("\t%s on %s: %d, %d\n", connection.connection.name.c_str(), connection.device.iface.c_str(),
00057         connection.connection_state, connection.device.state);
00058     if (!connection.ipv4_address.empty())
00059       printf("\t\tIPv4 Address: %s\n", connection.ipv4_address.c_str());
00060     printf("\n");
00061   }
00062   if(run_once)
00063     ros::shutdown();
00064 }
00065 void list_active_connections(bool run_once)
00066 {
00067   ros::NodeHandle n;
00068   ros::Subscriber connections_sub = n.subscribe<ActiveNetworkConnections>("oryx_active_network_connections", 10,
00069       boost::bind(list_active_connections_callback, _1, run_once));
00070   ros::spin();
00071 }
00072 
00073 void list_devices_callback(const NetworkDevices::ConstPtr& devices, bool run_once)
00074 {
00075   printf("Oryx Network Devices\n");
00076   printf("------------------------------------------------\n");
00077   for (unsigned int i = 0; i < devices->list.size(); ++i)
00078   {
00079     oryx_network_manager::NetworkDevice device = devices->list[i];
00080     printf("\t%s (%s): %d\n", device.iface.c_str(), device.product.c_str(), device.state);
00081     printf("\t\t%s Device\n", device.device_type.c_str());
00082     if (!device.driver.empty())
00083       printf("\t\tDriver: %s\n", device.driver.c_str());
00084     if (!device.hardware_address.empty())
00085       printf("\t\tHardware Address: %s\n", device.hardware_address.c_str());
00086     printf("\n");
00087   }
00088   if(run_once)
00089     ros::shutdown();
00090 }
00091 
00092 void list_devices(bool run_once)
00093 {
00094   ros::NodeHandle n;
00095   ros::Subscriber connections_sub = n.subscribe<NetworkDevices>("oryx_network_devices", 10,
00096       boost::bind(list_devices_callback, _1, run_once));
00097   ros::spin();
00098 }
00099 
00100 void connect(const char* iface, const char* connection_name)
00101 {
00102   printf("Connecting to '%s' on '%s'\n", connection_name, iface);
00103   oryx_network_manager::ActivateConnection activateConnection;
00104   activateConnection.request.connection_name = connection_name;
00105   activateConnection.request.device_iface = iface;
00106   if (ros::service::call("oryx_activate_network_connection", activateConnection))
00107   {
00108     if (!activateConnection.response.message.empty())
00109       printf("%s\n", activateConnection.response.message.c_str());
00110   }
00111   else
00112     printf("Service call to network manager failed. Make sure that the server is running and you are connected.\n");
00113 }
00114 
00115 void help(const char* message)
00116 {
00117   if (strcmp("", message) != 0)
00118     printf("%s\n", message);
00119   printf("Oryx Network Manager CLI Help:\n");
00120   printf("The following commands are supported\n");
00121   printf("\t%s\t\t\t\t\t%s\n", "cli help", "Show this message");
00122   printf("\t%s\t%s\n", "cli list [devices|connections|active]", "list the connections and devices on oryx");
00123   printf("\t%s\t\t%s\n", "cli connect <iface> <connection_name>",
00124       "connect to a specified connection on a specific device");
00125   printf("\t%s\t%s\n", "cli mon [devices|connections|active]",
00126       "listen for updates to the  connections and devices on oryx and display them");
00127 }
00128 
00129 int main(int argc, char **argv) //first arg is program name
00130 {
00131   ros::init(argc, argv, "oryx_network_manager_cli", ros::init_options::AnonymousName);
00132   ros::NodeHandle n;
00133 
00134   if (argc <= 1)
00135     help("");
00136   else if (strcmp("help", argv[1]) == 0)
00137     help("");
00138   else if (strcmp("list", argv[1]) == 0)
00139   {
00140     if (argc == 2)
00141       list_connections(true);
00142     else if (argc == 3)
00143     {
00144       if (strcmp("connections", argv[2]) == 0)
00145         list_connections(true);
00146       else if (strcmp("devices", argv[2]) == 0)
00147         list_devices(true);
00148       else if (strcmp("active", argv[2]) == 0)
00149         list_active_connections(true);
00150       else
00151         help("Unsupported list type\n");
00152     }
00153     else
00154       help("list only takes one argument");
00155   }
00156   else if (strcmp("mon", argv[1]) == 0)
00157   {
00158     if (argc == 2)
00159       list_connections(false);
00160     else if (argc == 3)
00161     {
00162       if (strcmp("connections", argv[2]) == 0)
00163         list_connections(false);
00164       else if (strcmp("devices", argv[2]) == 0)
00165         list_devices(false);
00166       else if (strcmp("active", argv[2]) == 0)
00167         list_active_connections(false);
00168       else
00169         help("Unsupported mon type\n");
00170     }
00171     else
00172       help("mon only takes one argument");
00173   }
00174   else if (strcmp("connect", argv[1]) == 0)
00175   {
00176     if (argc == 4)
00177       connect(argv[2], argv[3]);
00178     else
00179       help("connect takes 2 arguments");
00180   }
00181   else
00182   {
00183     char tmp[200];
00184     strcpy(tmp, "Unknown command: '");
00185     strcat(tmp, argv[1]);
00186     strcat(tmp, "'");
00187     help(tmp);
00188   }
00189 
00190   return 0;
00191 }
